channel.title: BBC News - Home
channel.description: The latest stories from the Home section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Corbyn 'cannot support air strikes'
item.description: Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn writes to his MPs saying he cannot back UK air strikes in Syria - prompting a warning of shadow cabinet resignations.

item.title: Syria air strikes 'will make us safer'
item.description: David Cameron puts the case for air strikes against IS in Syria - with Jeremy Corbyn at odds with half his shadow cabinet on the issue.

item.title: Russia plans sanctions against Turkey
item.description: Russia is preparing wide-ranging economic sanctions against Turkey after the downing of one of its jets, Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev says.

item.title: Lord Coe ends association with Nike
item.description: IAAF president Lord Coe ends his 38-year ambassadorial role with American sportswear giant Nike.

item.title: Number of untaxed UK vehicles doubles
item.description: The number of vehicles without road tax - Vehicle Excise Duty (VED) - doubled to 560,000 after the paper tax disc was abolished in October 2014.

item.title: BBC Three to move online from February
item.description: The BBC Trust formally approves proposals to move BBC Three online only from February, on the condition that programmes will be shown on BBC One and Two.

item.title: 'Very significant' cuts still to come
item.description: "Very significant" government spending cuts will be imposed before the next general election, the Institute for Fiscal Studies think tank warns.

item.title: Net migration to UK hits record 336,000
item.description: Annual net migration to the UK reaches a record 336,000, with 294,000 people arriving in the UK for work, figures show.

item.title: Families win carers' benefit cap case
item.description: The government discriminated against disabled people by failing to exempt some unpaid carers from the cap on benefits, the High Court rules.

item.title: Trump mocks disabled reporter
item.description: Republican presidential contender Donald Trump is criticised for mocking a disabled New York Times reporter.
